title: Patrick Stoddart
text:
Patrick Stoddart (born 1944), is a <a href="British%20people">British</a> <a href="journalist">journalist</a>, media consultant and presenter who was the media editor and television critic of "<a href="The%20Sunday%20Times">The Sunday Times</a>."
He attended <a href="Watford%20Grammar%20School%20for%20Boys">Watford Grammar School for Boys</a> and began his career in journalism with the "<a href="Watford%20Observer">Watford Observer</a>." He then worked for the "<a href="London%20Evening%20News">London Evening News</a>." He has also presented television and radio programmes including "<a href="The%20Media%20Show">The Media Show</a>" and has worked for <a href="ITV%20%28TV%20network%29">ITV</a>, <a href="Channel%204">Channel 4</a> and <a href="BBC%20Radio%204">Radio 4</a>. In 1992 he won a celebrity special edition of "<a href="Fifteen%20to%20One">Fifteen to One</a>." He later founded a media consultancy and became a senior lecturer in journalism at the <a href="University%20of%20Westminster">University of Westminster</a>.
